summary: Haifa is the third-largest city in Israel, with a rich history dating back 3,000 years. It's located on Mount Carmel and has been ruled by many groups over time. Today, it's known for its seaport, universities (like the Technion), and the Baháʼí Faith's holy site. Haifa is a key part of Israel's economy, with a high-tech park and heavy industry in the Haifa Bay area. It's also the only Israeli city with an underground train system called the Carmelit.
title: Haifa
